basis: No actual eating action is documented in this final turn; the user expresses intent to eat the apple and almond butter only if the urge persists after the pause.
cognitive_dissonance: Mild internal conflict: user acknowledges BED tendencies while committing to the plan, with no overt resistance or self-criticism.
negative_thought_patterns: No explicit negative beliefs recorded; mentions BED tendencies and stress as triggers, with potential risk of all-or-nothing thinking if urges worsen.
emotional_triggers: Stress and evening cues triggering urges; awareness of BED tendencies as a factor.
coaching_notes: Maintain a warm, non-judgmental tone; continue with urge-regulation micro-routines (body scan, slow breaths, water, logging). Emphasize concrete next steps and urge-tracking to reduce escalation; monitor for cognitive distortions and BED-related patterns, and plan future sessions around trigger management and gradual behavior change.
